column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=Polycrystalline samples of Cs2Mo3As3 were synthesized by
#Text=the high temperature solid state reaction method starting with Cs
#Text=(lumps, 99.98%), Mo (powder, 99.999%), and As (powder, 99.999%).
#Text=The preparation process consists of three steps.
#Text=First, the CsAs pre-
#Text=cursor was prepared as the parent material.
#Text=Cs lumps and As powder
#Text=were mixed with a stoichiometric ratio of 1:1 in an argon-filled glove
#Text=box, loaded into an alumina crucible and sealed into an evacuated
#Text=quartz tube.
#Text=The quartz tube was slowly (4 K/h) heated to 523 K,
#Text=held for 20 h, and then cooled down to room temperature.
#Text=The mix-
#Text=ture after heating was collected and ground into fine powder with
#Text=an agate mortar in a glove box.
#Text=Second, the obtained CsAs powder,
#Text=together with Mo and As powder in a stoichiometric ratio of 2.3:3:0.7
#Text=(the excess of Cs is to compensate for the loss of Cs during the sin-
#Text=tering process), was fully ground in the agate mortar and pressed
#Text=into pellets, which was, then, sealed into an evacuated quartz tube
#Text=and heated at 523 K for 20 h followed by furnace cooling.
#Text=Third,
#Text=the product was ground in a glove box, pressed into pellets, and
#Text=placed in an alumina crucible again.
#Text=The crucible was sealed into
#Text=a Ta Tube with arc welding before finally being sealed into an evac-
#Text=uated quartz tube.
#Text=Then, the tube containing the sample was heated
#Text=to 1123 K, held for 50 h, and cooled down to room temperature
#Text=with the furnace.
#Text=After that, the samples of single phase Cs2Mo3As3
#Text=were obtained for structural and physical characterizations.
#Text=We note
#Text=that different from the previously reported preparation of polycrys-
#Text=talline K2Mo3As3 samples,32 an additional sintering process at 523 K
#Text=is necessary to make the sample more homogeneous and obtain
#Text=single phase samples with bulk superconductivity.
#Text=Otherwise, very
#Text=low superconducting volume fraction was observed, which may be
#Text=related to the deviation from stoichiometric proportions of the sam-
#Text=ple composition.
#Text=The polycrystalline samples synthesized by the
#Text=above method are black and show good ductility under pressure.
#Text=The starting material Cs, the intermediate CsAs, and the obtained
#Text=Cs2Mo3As3 samples are all very reactive to the oxygen and the mois-
#Text=ture in the air; hence, the weighing, grinding, and other processes
#Text=mentioned above need to be carried out carefully in a high-purity
#Text=argon atmosphere, and any exposure to the air should be avoided in
#Text=all processes.
